note: [The gang is walking to a newsstand late at night. Joey is anxiously in the lead.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, would you slow down? They’re not gonna be sold out of papers at one o’clock in the morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m excited! I’ve never gotten reviewed before.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You were so amazing as the king. I was really impressed, I was.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Although, you know what? You might want to consider wearing underwear next time. Yeah, cause when you sat down on your throne you could kind of see your… royal subject.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here it is, here it is. [reading from newspaper] The only thing worse than the mindless, adolescent direction was Joseph Tribbiani’s disturbingly unskilled portrayal of the king.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, look, that is one guy’s opinion, alright. Phoebs, read yours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. [reading] The only thing worse than the mindless, adolescent direction…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does anyone have one from a different paper? Ross, read yours.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t want to.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, honey, they don’t know what they’re talking about.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe they do. I’ve been doin’ this ten years and I haven’t gotten anywhere. There’s gotta be a reason.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh c’mon. Maybe you’re just, uhhh… paying your dues.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, it.. it’s too hard. It’s not worth it. I quit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait one minute. Wait a minute. I believe this will change your mind. [Reads from paper] In a mediocre play, Joseph Tribbiana was able to achieve brilliant new levels of… continued on page 153…[turns it] sucking.

content.description: Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica comforting Joey at Monica and Rachel’s apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When I was little, I wanted to be a veteranarian, but then I found out you had to put your hands into cows and stuff.
[Ross enters, depressed.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [sullenly] Hiiiiii.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are… are you OK?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, just a tough day at work. A stegosaurus fell over and trapped a kid. Whoa, whoa, I know this jacket, this is, th—Fun Bobby’s jacket! Where is he, what. He, he’s here, isn’t he?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t toy with me.
[Fun Bobby enters from Monica’s bedroom.]

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Geller!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Fun Bobby!

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Hey. Whoa, hey, you’ve been working out, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not at all! I love this guy. Hey, I was so psyched to hear you’re back with my sister!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You and me both.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Hey, so what’d I miss, what’d I miss, c’mon?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, we were just trying to make Joey feel better.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Hey, do you need me to pick you up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m alright man. Really.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: No, I’m picking you up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey no, seriously, I don’t need you to pick me… [Fun Bobby picks Joey up off the ground, bounces him. Joey laughs.] Alright! It still works.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: OK, now before I go, does anybody else need to be picked up? [everyone raises their hands] I’m still gonna go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, I’ll see you later babe.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Uh, public display of affection coming up. You can avert your eyes. [kisses Monica]
[Chandler and Joey are watching, Rachel turns their heads away from Monica.]

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: See ya. [exits]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye! See you later!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fun Bobby is so great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, isn’t he? Oh, you know, I really think this time it may work with him. I mean, he just makes me feel so good and I’ve been feeling so lousy this last couple of months, no job, no boyfriend. Well, at least my cup is half full.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Half full of looooovvvvve .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And for our two-week anniversary, he’s gonna take me to his cousin’s cabin for the weekend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cabin of loooooovvvvve .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We went through a lot of wine tonight, you guys. [walks over to table, holding five empty wine bottles]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? I only had two glasses.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just had a glass.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Two.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I had one glass.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I had about a mugful in this lovely ‘I got boned at the Museum of Natural History’ mug.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, so that’s… that’s what, two bottles? And yet somehow we went through five?
[All look towards door Fun Bobby left through.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oooooh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [realizing what everyone else did a minute ago] Ooooooh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what. So he drank a lot tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but, you know, now that I think about it, I don’t think I’ve ever seen Fun Bobby without a… a drink in his hand.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Oh, OOOH, yeah, you know, did you notice how he always starts his stories with, um, OK, ‘I was soooo wasted,’ or, ‘Oh, we were soooo bombed,’ or, ummm, ooh, ooh, ’so I wake up, and I’m in this dumpster in Connecticut.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica, have you ever been with him when he wasn’t drinking?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we just happen to go to alot of places where you might drink. I mean, how do you go to a wine tasting without having a drink? Or… or to a club, or to the… zoo.

content.description: [Scene: Monica, Fun Bobby, and Phoebe sitting in Central Perk Rachel is serving them. She brings a mug to Monica.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, does this have nonfat milk?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ehhhummmm, I don’t know, why don’t you taste it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [takes a sip] Mmmm, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, too late, sorry, you already had some.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: [pulls out a flask] Whattaya say we make these, uh, coffees Irish?
[Phoebe and Rachel look uncomfortable.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, cake.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we’re gonna… we’re gonna get some cake. [Phoebe and Rachel go to counter.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? It seems like you’ve been making an awful lot of stuff Irish lately.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Well, I would make them Belgian, but the waffles are hard to get into that flask.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bobby.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Yeah, OK.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, maybe this is none of my business, or maybe it is, I don’t know… but, uh, I’m kind of worried about you.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: OK, look, this isn’t the first time somebody’s said something to me about this, but, I don’t know… I always made excuses about it, like… uhhh… ‘I’m just a social drinker,’ or, ‘C’mon, it’s Flag Day.’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, what are you saying now?

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: I guess I’m saying, I’ll try and quit. I kinda like that you worry about me. [they hug]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [comes back to couch, with cake] Sooo, what’s goin’ on, huh?

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: I am gonna try and quit drinking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [sad] Ooohh, why?
[Chandler and Joey enter.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guess who’s back in show business.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, ohh, Lorne Green?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, Phoebs. You know why? Cause he’s dead.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, I guess this is gonna seem kinda bittersweet now, but… Joey, that’s who.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, my agent just called me with an audition for Days of Our Lives !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, we have to celebrate. You know what we should do? We should do, like, a soap opera theme.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, yeah… we could all sleep together and then one of us could get amnesia.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rach, what time do you get off? We’re all gonna do something tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ummmm… well, actually I’m already done, but I…I kinda got plans.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [gasps] You have other friends?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah… I, uhh… I have a… I have a date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: With a man?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What is so strange about me having a date?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about Ross? I mean, are you still mad at him cause he made that list about you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooo, no, I’m not mad at him. I’m.. I’m not really anything at him anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Whatever I was feeling, I’m… not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But you guys came so close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know, I’m sorry you guys. You’re just gonna have to get used to the fact that I will not be dating Ross.
[Russ enters Central Perk. He looks like Ross, except for his chin and hair (it is David Schwimmer in a dual role).]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here he is. Hi. Guys, this is Russ.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: [sounding like Ross] Hhhhiiiii.
[Everyone looks at each other in amazement.]

content.description: [Scene: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency. Estelle (ESTL) is speaking on the phone.]

content.text: ESTL: Stop saying you’re not talented, you’re very talented. It’s just with the bird dead and all, there’s very little act left. Oh, honey, give me a break, will ya? [a knock on the door] Oooh, ooh, I’ll talk to you later.
[Joey enters.]
ESTL: Well, there’s my favorite client. So tell me darling, how was the audition?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I think it went pretty well. I.. I got a callback for Thursday.
ESTL: Joey, have you ever seen me ecstatic?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.
ESTL: Well, here it is. [She almost smiles.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK, uh… listen, there’s something I want to talk to you about. The network casting lady…
ESTL: Oh, isn’t Lori a doll?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah, she’s great, but… I kinda got the feeling that she was sort of… coming on to me. And I definitely would get the part if I would’ve… you know… if I would have sent the Little General in.

ESTL: Oh, I see. Well, I’m just gonna put in a call here and we’ll find out what’s goin’ on and straighten it out. [picks up the phone] Yeah, hi, Lori please. [pause] Hi darling. So how ‘bout Joey Tribbiani for the part of the cab driver, isn’t he terrific? [pause] Uh-huuuuh. [pause] Uh-huuuuh. OK, doll. Talk to you later. [hangs up] [to Joey] Yeah, you’re gonna have to sleep with her.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel at counter, Phoebe, Chandler, and Fun Bobby at the couch.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Fun Bobby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, isn’t he sober?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, he’s sober alright. Just turns out that Fun Bobby was fun for a reason.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh, OK.
[Monica returns to couch next to Fun Bobby.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, here you go, sweetie. [hands Fun Bobby his coffee]

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Thanks. You wanna hear something funny?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, yes!

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: There are no hardware stores open past midnight in the Village.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is funny.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: I needed to buy a hammer the other night, and I’m out walkin’ around the neighborhood but apparently there are no hardware stores open past midnight in the Village.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahhh, hey honey? Don’t you have to be at your interview now?

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Oh yeah. See you guys. [leaves]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye… ridiculously dull Bobby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh… my… God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not that bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not that bad? Did you hear the hammer story?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, OK, don’t get all squinky.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe it was just the kind of story where you have to be there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I’m gonna be there… for the rest of my life. I mean, I can’t break up with him. I’m the one who made him quit drinking. He’s dull because of me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, don’t say that. He’s probably always been dull. You just, you know, set it free.
[Russ enters, walking in behind Chandler.]

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [turning around] Hey Ross… bahhhh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Russ, I’ve just got two more tables to clean and then we’ll go, OK?

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: OK, I’ll just sit here and… uh… chat with your, uh… friend-type…people.
[Phoebe walks up to Rachel, cleaning tables.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel? Um, hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, so, you know what you’re doing, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh… waitressing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah, but… no. I mean, umm… doesn’t… doesn’t Russ just remind you of someone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [looks at him] Huh, Bob Saget?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [looks at Russ] Oh, yeah! No, no, no, no, oh, oh.
[Phoebe turns back around but Rachel is gone. Ross enters.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, my, oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, OK…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s just upset because she, uh, she buttered a spider into her toast this morning.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to Phoebe] Listen, Phoebs, this is gonna be OK. [introducing Russ and Ross] Ross, Russ. Russ, Ross.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Are you a, uh, friend of Rachel’s?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes I am. Are you a, uh, a friend of Rachel’s?

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Actually, I’m a… kind of a… you know, a… date-type… thing… of Rachel’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A date.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Yeah, I’m her date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh, you’re… uh… you’re, oh you’re the date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, this is actually good, because if we ever lose Ross, we have a spare.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Oh, you are the, uh… paleontologist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes I am. And you are a…

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Periodontist.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See? They’re as different as night and… later that night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I am going to, uh… get a beverage. It was nice, nice… uh… meeting you.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Ditto.
[ROss approaches Rachel at counter.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, uh, well… I… I met Russ.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I didn’t know we were, uh, seeing other people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we’re not seeing each other, so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, uh, for your information, there’s a woman at the museum, who’s curator of moths and other… uh… winged things… who’s, uh, let it be known that she is drawn to me much like a… well, you know. But so far I’ve been keeping her at bay, but, uh, if this is the deal…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, yeah, this is the deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, well, um, have a nice evening.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, Russ, you ready?

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye.
[Russ and Rachel leave together.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [upset] She’s dating. She’s dating.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes, but did you see who she was dating?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you not see it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See what? I don’t know what she sees in… innn that goober. And it takes him, what? Like… like… I don’t know, uhh… uhhh, hello… a… week, to get out a sentence.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s annoying, isn’t it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ……………Yeah.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Joey is making marinara sauce and filling every container in sight. Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa, whoa, so I’m guessing you didn’t get the part, or… uh, Italy called and said it was hungry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the part’s mine if I want it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, if I’m willing to sleep with the casting lady.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [not knowing how to react] Oh my… God?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ten years I’ve been waiting for a break like this Chandler, ten years! I mean, Days of Our Lives . That’s actually on television.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I guess I could sleep with her… I mean, how could I do that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I… I’ve got a pop-up book that told me everything I need to know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve never slept with someone for a part.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well is she… [reaches into the cookie jar for a cookie, takes his hand out, covered with pasta sauce]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s alright. Is she good-looking?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she’s totally good looking. I mean, if I met her in a bar, or something, I’d be buying her breakfast. [pause] You know, after having slept with her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, maybe this isn’t such a big deal. Y’know, I mean, the way that I see it is you get a great job and you get to have sex. Y’know, I mean, throw in a tree and a fat guy and you’ve got Christmas.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just… I just don’t think that I want it that way though, y’know? I mean, let’s say I do make it, alright? I’m always gonna look back and wonder if it was because of my talent or because of.. y’know, the Little General.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Didn’t you used to call it the Little Major?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but after Denise DeMarco, I had to promote it.

content.description: A restaurant. Fun Bobby and Monica are ordering.

content.text: WAITER: Can I get you something from the bar?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, I would like something. [looks at Fun Bobby, changes her mind] No, no thank you.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: If… if you want to drink, it’s OK with me, I’ve got to get used to it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no really. I.. I wouldn’t feel right about it. [to waiter] Just some water.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: So the light went out in my refrigerator…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [grabs waiter as he’s leaving] I’d like a scotch on the rocks with a twist.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Chandler is sitting on the couch between Russ and Ross, doing a crossword puzzle.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, we’re having some fun now, huh, Ross? Wanna do another one, huh Russ? OK… eleven letters, atomic element number 101… ends in ium .

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Dysprosium.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [condescendingly] Dysprosium? Try mendelevium.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And weenie number two has it. Unless, of course, nine-down, Knights in White Satin was sung by the Doody Blues.
[Phoebe and Rachel are at the counter talking.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t see it? You actually don’t see it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK honey, you’re dating Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, Phoebs. I’m dating Russ .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Russ is Ross. Russ… Ross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Steve… sleeve!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, noone is named Sleeve.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, what the hell are you talking about? Other than their names being similar, I’m sorry, I do not see what you’re seeing.
[They look over at Russ and Ross.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [to Russ] For your information, it’s a card sharp, not a card shark.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: You could not be more wrong. You could try… but you would not be successful.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, I’m gonna get some more coffee before the pinching and eye-poking begins.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: I know what your problem is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh you do, do you?

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Um-hum, you’re jealous.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of… of what?

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: You’re jealous because I’m a real doctor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you’re a doctor of gums . That’s the smallest body part you can major in. It’s like day one, floss. Day two, here’s your diploma.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Hey, you listen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, let me finish.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: No, let me finish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you let me fini…
[Rachel walks up behind them.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ewww, ewww, ewww, ewww! [turns away]

content.description: Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Chandler at Monica and Rachel’s apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did Joey say what he was gonna go when he left?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I don’t even think he knew. Hey, would you sleep with somebody to get a great job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Who would I have to sleep with?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why would I have to sleep with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s my game. You want the job or not?
[Monica enters from her bedroom.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where ya goin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bobby and I are going away for the weekend, remember?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooooohhhh.
[Monica pulls out a bag full of airline bottles of liquor.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s with all the bottles of liquor?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on, is… uh, Bobby drinking again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no no, this is not for him, this is for me. That way he’s still sober but I find his stories about shoelaces much more amusing.
[Three slow knocks on the door.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, even his knock is boring.
[Monica answers the door. Its Fun Bobby.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. I’ll be ready in just a second.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Uh, can I talk to you a minute?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure.
[They both step out into the hall.]

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: This is really hard for me to say.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, you fell off the wagon.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Oh, no, no, it’s about you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about me?

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: I think you may have a drinking problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What these? [holding up liquor bottles] Oh, these are, um, for.. cuts and scrapes.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Look, I am just not strong enough to be in a codependent relationship right now, OK?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh… shoot.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Well, anyway, I hope we can be friends.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK.
[They hug and kiss.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Take care.

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: You too.
[Fun Bobby leaves and Monica goes back inside.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well we… we kinda broke up.

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Awwwwwwww.
[Ross, Phoebe, Chandler, and Rachel all exchange money.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [holding bottles] Does anybody want these?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll take one. Sometimes I like to hold stuff like this and pretend I’m a giant.
[Joey enters.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’d the callback go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It was unbelievable! I walked in there and she was all over me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what’d you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I couldn’t do it. I told her I didn’t want to get the part that way.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But wait, wait, wait. Then, after I left her office, she caught up with me at the elevator and offered me an even bigger part.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So… and?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Soooooo… you are now looking at Dr. Drake Ramore, neurosurgeon, recurring in at least four episodes!

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Allright!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright… I’ve got to go shower. [leaves]
[Phoebe, Ross, Rachel, Chandler exchange money again.]

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: I guess you guys heard, Rachel dumped me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m sorry man.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Oh, all she said was that I remind her too much of somebody. You have any idea who she’s talking about?
[Chandler and Phoebe feign ignorance.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I do, it’s… it’s Bob Saget. She hates him.

content.speaker: Russ
content.text: Oh.
[Julie… Ross’s ex-girlfriend… enters.]

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Julie! Hey, how are you doing?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Um, oh, I don’t know. I mean, it’s definitely weird not being with Ross, but I guess I’m doing OK. Actually I’ve got some of his stuff that he, um…
[Russ and Julie look at each other with love in their eyes. The music builds…]
